snippet: China is vigorously debating whether it is overly obsessed with gold medals (while being somewhat dismissive of silver and bronze); whether the state-sponsored sports system is both draconian and outmoded; and whether heartfelt patriotism has perhaps...
abstract: China is vigorously debating whether it is overly obsessed with gold medals (while being somewhat dismissive of silver and bronze); whether the state-sponsored sports system is both draconian and outmoded; and whether heartfelt patriotism has perhaps veered into a nationalistic fervor.

headline.main: Too Much Olympic Fever in China?
